data.title: An Evening with Bestselling Author Lord Roberts of Belgravia
data.meta_description: Pacific Research Institute presents An Evening With Bestselling Author Lord Roberts of Belgravia at The California Club   6-9pm Friday, August 2, 2024 The California Club 538 Flower Street Los Angeles, CA 90071 Reception and Dinner $150 per person/$2500 per table (10 guests)   Acclaimed historian and award-winning Andrew Roberts joins us with remarks […]
data.text:
August 2, 2024

6:00 pm

The California Club

538 Flower St, Los Angeles, CA, USA

Pacific Research Institute presents

An Evening With Bestselling Author

Lord Roberts of Belgravia

at The California Club

6-9pm

Friday, August 2, 2024

The California Club

538 Flower Street

Los Angeles, CA 90071

Reception and Dinner

$150 per person/$2500 per table (10 guests)

Acclaimed historian and award-winning Andrew Roberts joins us with remarks on his latest New York Times bestseller book, Conflict: The Evolution of Warfare from 1945 to Ukraine (October 2023) The book, co-authored with General David Petraeus, former commander of the US-led coalition in both Iraq and Afghanistan and former Director of the CIA, and the military historian Professor Andrew Roberts, identify what were the lessons that Putin ought to have learned, and explain how not putting them into practice has led to profound strategic and tactical problems in Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Conflict explores over 70 years of conflict, drawing significant lessons and insights from their fresh analysis of the past.

—–

Books available for purchase.

Prof. Andrew Roberts, who was born in 1963, took a first class honours degree in Modern History at Gonville & Caius College, Cambridge, from where he is an honorary senior scholar and a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD).

He is a Bonnie and Tom McCloskey Distinguished Visiting Fellow at the Hoover Institution at Stanford University, a Visiting Professor at the War Studies Department at King’s College, London, and the Lehrman Institute Lecturer at the New-York Historical Society.

He has written or edited twenty books, which have been translated into twenty-eight languages, and appears regularly on radio and television around the world. Based in London, he is an accomplished public speaker and has delivered the White House Lecture, as well as speaking at Oxford, Cambridge, Yale, Princeton and Stanford Universities, and at The British Academy, the Foreign and Commonwealth Office, Sandhurst, Shrivenham and the US Army War College in Carlisle, Pennsylvania.
